text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen if 
you've been to Thailand you know that you

can find noodle soups at just about every street 
corner however what a lot of people don't know is

that for many of these noodle soups you can order 
the dry version where the noodles don't come with

the broth which is great for when the weather is 
really hot and you just don't feel like a steaming

bowl of soup in front of your face right and so 
the version that I'm going to show you today is

called bamee hang bamee is egg noodles and hang 
means dry and it's one of the most popular types

for people to order dry and because there's no 
broth it's super easy to make at home so let's

get started so because there's no broth the 
noodles will get tossed in sort of a seasoning

sauce and this sauce you can actually make it 
however you like there are no rules about what

you have to put it and not put in every vendor 
has a different recipe so I'll just share with

you what I like to do so in here and I'm just 
gonna make one order just like on the street

a little bit of soy sauce and I'm also gonna put 
golden Mountain sauce which as you can see it's a

little bit darker it's just a different type of 
soy sauce if you don't have it you can just do

all soy sauce some fish sauce of course I always 
put fish sauce in my noodles and now this is very

important you have to put some sort of an oil in 
it because otherwise the noodles will be clumped

up together so this right here is garlic oil and 
all you have to do to get garlic oil is fry some

chopped garlic in vegetable oil or any kind 
of neutral flavored oil until the garlic is

golden and you keep the garlic and the oil is so 
wonderful a little bit of sweetness to balance

all that salt some sugar and also I like to add 
a little bit of vinegar helps brighten everything

you can do a squeeze a lime at the end but that's 
not common for this particular type of noodles and

as an option if you want the color to be a little 
bit darker you can add some black soy sauce just

a dash and it will add almost a slight molasses 
flavor make it a little bit richer and that is it

that's the seasoning sauce right there alright it 
is super easy to this all you have to do is blanch

things and throw it in the bowl that's it you just 
have to get all the ingredients ready okay so I'm

gonna start with my veggies and I've got here 
some baby bok choy you can use regular bok choy

but the baby ones are so cute and it's just easier 
to eat right so they're smaller you can use other

greens if you want and I'm just gonna blanch 
them in some boiling water and these literally

take 30 seconds that looks good I'm just gonna 
take it out shake off as much water as you can

and we'll just set it aside for now I am adding 
some wonton so these are wontons that I made and

I have a recipe for how you can make it yourself 
however this is completely optional I just wanted

to show you because the very common thing for 
people to have in their by me hang and I made

this yesterday so I'm just going to quickly real 
anch them to heat them up again okay so I'm gonna

take them out I always want to oil my wontons as 
well because they can stick together if they sit

there too long so just a little bit of my garlic 
oil see this is so useful and cost them around a

little bit the next thing we're gonna Blanche is 
noodles now I'm using egg noodles here and this

is the flat kind you don't have to use the flat 
kind you can use the round kind if you want but

you want to make sure it's thin and delicate so 
not the ramen type noodles you want Chinese egg

noodles these ones were labeled wonton noodles 
blanch these in some boiling water and that's

just gonna take about one minute wonton noodles do 
not take long at all all right I'm just going to

fish these out and put them directly in the bowl 
of seasoning just get all the water out though

there we go move back here and you just want 
to toss the noodles in that sauce so that the

noodles can absorb the seasoning and also the oil 
will coat the noodles so they won't clump together

and now if this is your first time making it make 
sure you taste and you can adjust the seasoning

at this point okay all right let's put the noodles 
together so now my noodles go in okay this is like

double the size of if I call tae-bum II hang 
so in Thailand you'll just get half of it but

it's okay we're doing Canadian size box shall 
I go on the side I'm going to add a couple of

wontons there we go and then I'm going to add 
sort of a classic protein to go with bhumi hang

and that is Chinese barbecue pork or mo dang now 
this is just one that I bought so if you've got

a favorite Chinese restaurant they'll definitely 
sell it to you you can also just roast your own

pork simply I'll make sure like I attached a 
recipe that you can use for that purpose think

it's almost done how easy it was that toppings 
is so important the fried garlic from the garlic

oil I fried the garlic and I separated the two 
so that this stays crispy so good you want to

sprinkle it on top you want to make this spicy 
okay a little bit just a little bit whatever

you can tolerate so I'm going to add a little bit 
of chili flakes chili powder and this is one that

I roasted myself a little bit of white pepper and 
one last final garnish I'm going to sprinkle some

green onions and cilantro a duo it's sort of like 
our version of chopped parsley it gets sprinkled

on top of everything and that is it look how 
easy that was I'm so good mmm you want to toss

everything together little bit of the pork got 
to put a little piece of baby bok choy on there

mmm oh that's so good that just brings me back 
to the streets of Thailand the texture of these

wonton noodles are just they're so good they're 
like silky and slippery and just so much fun to

eat just simple well balanced flavors just hit 
the spot that was just so easy to make and it's

actually really fun when you've got lots of 
people and you can get everyone to make their

own bowl of noodles they can put whatever you want 
in it so good so the recipe as always will be on

how spicy Cheng calm when you make it definitely 
send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram

and subscribe to the show if you haven't done 
so so you never miss an episode and I will see

you next time for your next clue vicious 
Titan now put it in the seasoning why good
